cookie_preferences_page.title: Cookies on Roadside Payments service
cookie_preferences_page.cookies_text_definition: Cookies are files saved on your phone, tablet or computer when you visit a website.
cookie_preferences_page.cookies_text_use: We use cookies to store information about how you use the Roadside Payments service, such as the pages you visit.
cookie_preferences_page.cookie_settings_text: We use 2 types of cookie. You can choose if you're happy for us to use the non-essential cookies.
cookie_preferences_page.analytics_text: We use Google Analytics to measure how you use the website so we can improve it based on user needs. Google Analytics sets cookies that store anonymised information about:
cookie_preferences_page.analytics_text_list_one: how you got to the site
cookie_preferences_page.analytics_text_list_two: the pages you visit on Roadside Payments and government digital services, and how long you spend on each page
cookie_preferences_page.analytics_text_list_three: what you click on while you're visiting the site
cookie_preferences_page.analytics_privacy: Google doesn’t collect or store your personal information, such as your name or address, so this information can’t be used to identify who you are.
cookie_preferences_page.essential_cookies_text: These essential cookies do things like remember your progress through a form (for example a licence application)
cookie_preferences_page.essential_cookies_info: They always need to be on.
cookie_preferences_page.essential_find_out_more: Find out more about cookies on Roadside Payments
cookie_preferences_page.confirmation_text: Government services may set additional cookies and, if so, will have their own cookie policy and banner.
cookie_preferences_page.confirmation_link: Go back to the page you were looking at

cookie_details_page.title: Details about cookies on Roadside Payments service
cookie_details_page.cookies_text_definition: Roadside Payments puts small files (known as ‘cookies’) onto your computer to collect information about how you browse the site. Find out more about the cookies we use, what they’re for and when they expire.
cookie_details_page.analytics_text: We use Google Analytics software (Universal Analytics) to collect anonymised information about how you use Roadside Payments. We do this to help make sure the site is meeting the needs of its users and to help us make improvements to the site and to government digital services.
cookie_details_page.analytics_text_list_one: how you got to the site
cookie_details_page.analytics_text_list_two: the pages you visit on Roadside Payments and government digital services, and how long you spend on each page
cookie_details_page.analytics_text_list_three: what you click on while you're visiting the site
cookie_details_page.analytics_privacy: Google doesn’t collect or store your personal information, such as your name or address, so this information can’t be used to identify who you are.
cookie_details_page.analytics_cookie_purpose_one: These help us count how many people visit Roadside Payments by tracking if you’ve visited before
cookie_details_page.analytics_cookie_purpose_two: These help us count how many people visit Roadside Payments by tracking if you’ve visited before
cookie_details_page.essential_cookies_language_text: When you choose to use the Roadside Payments service using a language other than English, we'll set a cookie to remember your chosen language throughout your journey. This cookie does not store any personal data and is deleted when you close your browser.
cookie_details_page.essential_cookies_banner_text: You may see a banner when you visit Roadside Payments inviting you to accept cookies or review your settings. We’ll set cookies so that your computer knows you’ve seen it and not to show it again, and also to store your settings. We will store if you've chosen to accept or reject analytics cookies for 1 year.
cookie_details_page.imperva_incapsula_cookies_text: Imperva Incapsula cookies help the Imperva Incapsula service identify malicious activity. The cookies collect information in an anonymous form. They don't collect or store any personal information (eg names or addresses) so this information can’t easily be used to identify who the user is. The only constant cookie is the Visitor ID (visid_incap_{ID}). Other Imperva Incapsula cookies are removed within 15 minutes or once the browser is closed.
cookie_details_page.imperva_incapsula_cookie_purpose_one: Contains an encrypted Session ID. Used to relate HTTP requests to a particular visit
cookie_details_page.imperva_incapsula_cookie_purpose_two: A network load balancer cookie used by the Incapsula application delivery platform
cookie_details_page.imperva_incapsula_cookie_purpose_three: Visitor-Cookie containing Visitor ID. This cookie is used to relate sessions to a specific visitor's device
cookie_details_page.language_cookie_purpose_one: This lets us know which language you have selected so we can automatically display pages in your chosen language throughout your journey
cookie_details_page.change_preferences_text: You can change which cookies you’re happy for us to use.

introduction.applies_to: This accessibility statement applies to the Roadside Payments app and payments portal.
introduction.ownership: This website is run by DVSA. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this website. For example, that means you should be able to:

should_be_able_to.text: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
zoom in up to 300% without the text spilling off the screen
navigate most of the website using just a keyboard
navigate most of the website using speech recognition software
listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)

introduction.text_simple: We’ve also made the website text as simple as possible to understand.
introduction.further_advice: AbilityNet (opens in new tab) has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.

accessibility.heading: How accessible this website is

If you’re not happy with how we respond to your complaint, contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS) (opens in new tab).

contact_by_phone.statement: Find out how to contact us 0300 123 9000

technical_info.heading: Technical information about this website's accessibility
technical_info.statement: DVSA is committed to making its website accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.

compliance_status.heading: Compliance status
compliance_status.statement: This website is fully compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.1 (opens in new tab) AA standard.

documents.heading: PDFs and other documents
documents.statement_one: The accessibility regulations do not require us to fix PDFs or other documents published before 23 September 2018 (opens in new tab) if they’re not essential to providing our services. For example, we do not plan to fix [example of non-essential document].
documents.statement_two: We do not plan to fix the PDF receipt automatically generated through the GOV.UK portal.

improving_accessibility.heading: What we’re doing to improve accessibility
improving_accessibility.statement: We will re-assess accessibility whenever there is a major change to the service, and we will respond to any accessibility issues raised by users of the service.

statement_preparation.heading: Preparation of this accessibility statement
statement_preparation.statement_one: This statement was prepared on 7th September 2020. It has not yet been reviewed.
statement_preparation.statement_two: This website was last accessibility tested on 5th September 2018. The test was carried out by Disability Accessibility Centre (DAC).
statement_preparation.statement_three: DAC tested the end-to-end payment journey on GOV.UK that would be accessed by end-users.
statement_preparation.statement_four: Testing was carried with various assistive technologies such as screen readers and speech recognition software to ensure it meets the WCAG AA requirements.
statement_preparation.statement_five: Note that no accessibility testing was performed on the DVSA staff internal portal nor the DVSA staff mobile app.

privacy_statement.title: Pay a DVSA roadside fine: privacy notice

introduction.heading: 1. About this service
introduction.about: The Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency (DVSA) provides this service so that bus, coach lorry and van drivers can pay roadside fines. DVSA is an executive agency of the Department for Transport (DfT).
introduction.purpose: We carry out checks on commercial vehicle drivers in England, Scotland and Wales. We can give you a fine (called a fixed penalty) if you commit an offence. This service lets you pay that fine.
introduction.dataController: The data controller for DVSA is DfT – a data controller determines the reasons and how personal data is processed. For more information, see the Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO) Data Protection Public Register. DfT’s registration number is Z7122992.

what_data.heading: 2. What data we need

what_we_need.statement: The personal data we collect from you will include:

details.text: payment details - including card number (numbers are encrypted and access is restricted), dates the card is valid from and to, issue number and card type (for example, MasterCard)

what_data.reason: We’ll scan the date of the offence, vehicle registration number, trailer ID, fine amount and fine reference number from the offence notice. This information is then sent to the application system along with either a phone number or email address for the person who is paying the fine. The application will create a token which is emailed or sent by text to the person who is paying for the fine along with a website address and unique reference code, which can be used to make the payment.
what_data.legal: The legal basis for processing this data is public task. The legislation to collect roadside fines is Road Safety Act 2006.

data.statement: We need the personal data we collect from you to:

details.text: send you or the person paying the fine a text message or email to pay the fine
generate a code to pay the fine

data.statement: We collect, use and store the data you give us for the reasons set out in this policy.

details.text: sell or rent your data to third parties
share your data with third parties for marketing purposes

data.law: We will share your data if required to do so by law – for example, by court order, or to prevent fraud or other crime.

how_long.heading: 5. How long we keep your data

data.statement: We’ll only keep your personal data for as long as it is needed for the reasons set out in this policy or as long as is required by law.
data.hold: We will hold your personal data for:

details.text: 72 hours in the central application in DVSA’s Amazon Web Services (AWS) account
7 years in card payment merchant services
28 days within the application on the iPhone or iPad

where.heading: 6. Where it might go
where.statement_one: Our IT infrastructure and technology has been checked to make sure it’s safe and secure. Data in the central application is stored in our AWS account, which is hosted in Ireland.
where.statement_two: We use Tesseract software to scan the form, read the necessary data and change it into text. The software does not store or transmit any image.
where.statement_three: We use an external company called Capita to collect the payment.

protection.heading: 7. Protecting your data and your rights
protection.statement_one: The DVSA personal information charter sets out what steps are taken to protect your data, and the rights you have over your data.

automated.heading: 8. Automated decision making and profiling
automated.statement_one: Your data is not subject to automated decision making or profiling as defined in data protection legislation.

changes.heading: 9. Changes to this notice
changes.statement_one: We may change this privacy notice at our discretion at any time.
changes.statement_two: When we change this notice, the date on the page will be updated. Any changes to this privacy notice will be applied to you and your data as of the revision date.
changes.statement_three: We encourage you to periodically review this privacy notice to be informed about how your data is protected.

contact.heading: 10. How to contact us
contact.statement_one: If you have any questions about anything in this document or if you consider that your personal data has been misused or mishandled you can contact the DVSA data protection manager
contact.customer_services: Contact DVSA customer services if you have a query that is not about how your personal data is used.
contact.regulator: You may also make a complaint to the Information Commissioner, who is an independent regulator.
